title: Four Men Arrested in Drug Overdose Death of 'The Wire' Actor Michael K. Williams; Federal authorities allege the men sold actor drugs tainted with the powerful synthetic opioid fentanyl
text:
Michael K. Williams was found dead on Sept. 6 in a drug overdose. The drugs that the 54-year-old actor ingested were sold to him a day earlier by members of the organization, the U.S. attorney said.

One of the accused, Irvin Cartagena, was caught on video allegedly handing the drugs to Mr. Williams, according to a still shot from surveillance video provided by the U.S. attorney's office.

Mr. Cartagena has been charged in federal court with narcotics conspiracy. He was arrested in Puerto Rico on Tuesday and will appear in court there Thursday, authorities said.

He has also been charged with causing Mr. Williams's death in connection to his alleged role in the narcotics ring, according to authorities.

Three other men, Hector Robles, Luis Cruz and Carlos Macci, were charged with conspiracy to distribute fentanyl, heroin and other drugs, the U.S. attorney's office said.
